answers.answer: hi zaxmom1.how are you? Well this post of yours shows that you are not much happy. Frankly since you are standing in an island and surrounded by too many problems. Hence you are getting a exaggerated response. Do you notice here 1and 1 is doing a 11 job rather than 2(in relation to the number of diseases).Don't worry. Continue the treatment of your doctor with full faith and you will see the response. Faith is important.If he has diagnosed all these, then he is giving you the correct treatment.And keep us informed also.regardsabhijeet

question: I have been hearing these noises in my head for a few years now.  It sounds like crunching glass.  It's coming from inside my head not my ears.  I hear it when i'm laying down on my back mostly like when I'm reading.  I have been diagnosed with spondolosis in the cervical area, a bulging disc in the lumbar area and a pinched nerve.  I also suffer from depression, type 2 diabetes, a goiter, high cholesterol, and sleep apnea.  Please help I'm just wondering if this is cause for concern.  my doctor just says don't worry about it. thanks
title: head noises
